intro: Tabernaemontana columbiensis, commonly known as the Colombian star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of Colombia. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant produces a bulbous root system and has lance-shaped, evergreen leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires partial to full sunlight for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
